result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dion Clarence Mitchell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dion Clarence Mitchell was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court waived DV surcharge because he is indigent.
Pay all other costs and surcharges. To be paid by 9/9/2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to sentence defendant is currently serving.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work.

Submit a DNA sample, pay any costs associated with it.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dion Clarence Mitchell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was scheduled for a trial today.
The court passed this case for the lunch hour to allow the defendant to decide if he wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing proceeded...
.
As to count 1:
  Defendant waived consitutional rights and pled no contest and was examined as to his plea.  No contest plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed with prejudice.
.
Parties wish to proceed with sentencing....
.
As to count 1:
The victim was in court but did not want to make a statement.
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to the sentence the defendant is serving,  with credit for -0- days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.
The court waived the DV surcharge because he is indigent.  Although, defendant is to submit to a DNA surcharge and pay any costs associated with it.
  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 09/09/2016, any amount remaining due and owing is subject to a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
   
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
  Court advised defendant  his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties are set for trial.
.
Case passed...
.
The defendant was in court and informed the court that he wanted to go to trial.
The district attorney stated the offer that is being revoked if the defendant goes to trial.
The defendant now informed the court that he may want to change his plea.
.
The court passed the case until after the lunch hour to allow the defendant to review his paperwork.
.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense waived the defendant's appearance today.
This case was calendared for a motion hearing today and final pretrial date.
The state will be trying to exclude "other acts" evidence.  No negotiations after today's date.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/09/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
FILED, SUBPOENA RECALLED (served and signed on 05-19-2015)

Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for adjourned Final Pretrial. Discussion regarding scheduling, motion issues, and speedy trial demand. Defendant WAIVES right to a speedy trial. Case set for a Motion Hearing/Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Cout VACATED Jury Trial date. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Motion Hearing date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Court held in chambers conference with both parties. For reasons placed on the record, the court adjourned case for Final Pretrial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case not scheduled for today. FILE NOT IN COURT. Defendant not produced. Case called at request of Defense Counsel. Defense motion to adjourn the Final Pretrial date of 5/7/2015 to 5/14/2014 due to scheduling conflict, GRANTED by the court. Court vacated Final Pretrial date of 5/07/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL  DEMAND. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kimberly T; Flores S; Vanessa R.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in court with attorney Jeffry R. Schwartz.  Defendant Dion Clarence Mitchell in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
